params.name: threshold
params.desc: Feature values below or equal to this are replaced by 0, above it by 1. Threshold may not be less than 0 for operations on sparse matrices.

params.name: n_bins
params.desc: The number of bins to produce. The intervals for the bins are determined by the minimum and maximum of the input data. Raises ValueError if n_bins < 2. If n_bins is an array, and there is an ignored feature at index i, n_bins[i] will be ignored.

params.name: encode
params.desc: Method used to encode the transformed result.

params.name: strategy
params.desc: Strategy used to define the widths of the bins.

params.name: neg_label
params.desc: Value with which negative labels must be encoded.

params.name: pos_label
params.desc: Value with which positive labels must be encoded.

params.name: sparse_output
params.desc: True if the returned array from transform is desired to be in sparse CSR format.

params.name: classes
params.desc: Indicates an ordering for the class labels

params.name: sparse_output
params.desc: Set to true if output binary array is desired in CSR sparse format

params.name: min
params.desc: Desired range of transformed data.

params.name: max
params.desc: Desired range of transformed data.

params.name: norm
params.desc: The norm to use to normalize each non zero sample.

params.name: categories
params.desc: Categories (unique values) per feature: ‘auto’ : Determine categories automatically from the training data. list : categories[i] holds the categories expected in the ith column. The passed categories should not mix strings and numeric values within a single feature, and should be sorted in case of numeric values. The used categories can be found in the categories_ attribute.

params.name: sparse
params.desc: Will return sparse matrix if set True else will return an array.

params.name: dtype
params.desc: Desired dtype of output.

params.name: handle_unknown
params.desc: Whether to raise an error or ignore if an unknown categorical feature is present during transform (value is to raise). When this parameter is set to ‘ignore’ and an unknown category is encountered during transform, the resulting one-hot encoded columns for this feature will be all zeros. In the inverse transform, an unknown category will be denoted as None.

params.name: categories
params.desc: Categories (unique values) per feature: ‘auto’ : Determine categories automatically from the training data. list : categories[i] holds the categories expected in the ith column. The passed categories should not mix strings and numeric values within a single feature, and should be sorted in case of numeric values. The used categories can be found in the categories_ attribute.

params.name: dtype
params.desc: Desired dtype of output.

params.name: degree
params.desc: The degree of the polynomial features.

params.name: interaction_only
params.desc: If true, only interaction features are produced: features that are products of at most degree distinct input features (so not x[1] ** 2, x[0] * x[2] ** 3, etc.).

params.name: include_bias
params.desc: If True (value), then include a bias column, the feature in which all polynomial powers are zero (i.e. a column of ones - acts as an intercept term in a linear model).

params.name: method
params.desc: The power transform method.

params.name: standardize
params.desc: Set to True to apply zero-mean, unit-variance normalization to the transformed output.

params.name: n_quantiles
params.desc: Number of quantiles to be computed. It corresponds to the number of landmarks used to discretize the cumulative density function.

params.name: output_distribution
params.desc: Marginal distribution for the transformed data. The choices are ‘uniform’ (default) or ‘normal’.

params.name: ignore_implicit_zeros
params.desc: Only applies to sparse matrices. If True, the sparse entries of the matrix are discarded to compute the quantile statistics. If False, these entries are treated as zeros.

params.name: subsample
params.desc: Maximum number of samples used to estimate the quantiles for computational efficiency. Note that the subsampling procedure may differ for value-identical sparse and dense matrices.

params.name: random_state
params.desc: If int, random_state is the seed used by the random number generator; If RandomState instance, random_state is the random number generator; If None, the random number generator is the RandomState instance used by np.random. Note that this is used by subsampling and smoothing noise.

params.name: with_centering
params.desc: If True, scale the data to interquartile range.

params.name: with_scaling
params.desc: If True, scale the data to interquartile range.

params.name: quantile_max
params.desc: Default: (25.0, 75.0) = (1st quantile, 3rd quantile) = IQR Quantile range used to calculate scale_.

params.name: quantile_min
params.desc: Default: (25.0, 75.0) = (1st quantile, 3rd quantile) = IQR Quantile range used to calculate scale_.

params.name: with_mean
params.desc: If True, center the data before scaling. This does not work (and will raise an exception) when attempted on sparse matrices, because centering them entails building a dense matrix which in common use cases is likely to be too large to fit in memory.

params.name: with_std
params.desc: If True, scale the data to unit variance (or equivalently, unit standard deviation).
